com.ericdaugherty.lib.configuration
Class ConfigurationService

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.ericdaugherty.lib.configuration.ConfigurationService
public class ConfigurationService
extends java.lang.Object

Centralized configuration manager. This class should be the single access point for all configuration information in a given application.

This class provides caching and dynamic configuration updates using multiple extendable sources.

Please refer to the configuration package documentation for complete documentation and useage information.

Author:
Eric Daugherty (http://www.ericdaugherty.com/java/daughertylib)

getInstance

public static ConfigurationService getInstance()
Provides access to the default singleton instance of ConfigurationService. If the singleton instance does not exist, a new one is created using the default settings.
Returns:
singleton instance of the ConfigurationService

Parses the first node name from the begining of the string. If the delimiter could not be found in the string, the original key is returned.
Parameters:
key - String to parse
Returns:
first (or only) node in the string

parseLastNode

public java.lang.String parseLastNode(java.lang.String key)

Returns:

parseFirstNodes

public java.lang.String parseFirstNodes(java.lang.String key)
Removes the last name from the end of the string and returns the begining of the string up to (but not including) the last delimiter. If there is only one node in the string, an empty string is returned.
Parameters:
key - String to parse
Returns:
nodes 1 to (n - 1), or and empty string if there is only one node in the string.

parseLastNodes

public java.lang.String parseLastNodes(java.lang.String key)
Removes the first name from the begining of the string and returns the string begining with the second node name through the end of the string. If there is only one node in the string, an empty string is returned.
Parameters:
key - String to parse
Returns:
nodes 2 to n, or and empty string if there is only one node in the string.

convertDelimiter

public java.lang.String convertDelimiter(java.lang.String sourceKey,
                                         java.lang.String sourceDelimiter)
Converts the specified key with the specified delimiter into a key that uses the ConfigurationService delimiter.

This is useful when loading a property from a source that uses a delimiter that is different from the ConfigurationService's delimiter.

Parameters:
sourceKey - the key to convert
sourceDelimiter - the delimiter used by the source key.
Returns:
the new key with the correct delimiter

getConfigurationSources

public ConfigurationSource[] getConfigurationSources()
Provides access to the currently defined ConfigurationSources.
Returns:
array of ConfigurationSource instances used by this class

addConfigurationSource

public void addConfigurationSource(ConfigurationSource source)
                            throws ConfigurationException
Adds the parameters from a ConfigurationSource to the cached configuration information. Combines the configuration data from the specified ConfigurationSource with the existing tree. However, any values that have already been defined will NOT be overwritten with new values. Once a value is defined, it can not be changed by a 'new' ConfigurationSource. However, new values that 'override' old values, such as more specific environment variables will overwrite the old values, as expected.
Parameters:
source - the source containing the parameters to add.
Throws:
ConfigurationException - if there is an error adding the source.

removeConfigurationSource

public void removeConfigurationSource(ConfigurationSource source)
This method removes a specific configuration source from the list of sources, and removes all of it's values from the configuration data.

This method removes the specified source without causing any problems acessing other configuration information, so it may be safely called in a 'live' environment.

This method removes all the values, but does not clean up empty nodes from the tree. These nodes should not cause any problem, although repeated adds and removes may create extra memory useage and slow down some operations over time.

It should also be noted that any cases where this source contained a value that 'overrode' another source, such as environment variables, this sources variable will be removed, but the other sources 'overridden' value will NOT be restored. To restore the overridden values, call the refresh method.

Parameters:
source - a reference to the SAME INSTANCE that was passed to the addConfigurationSource() method.

updateConfigurationSource

public void updateConfigurationSource(ConfigurationSource source)
                               throws ConfigurationException
This method allows ConfigurationSource implementations to notify the ConfigurationService when the configuration data in that source has been updated.

This allows individual ConfigurationSources to initiate updates instead of waiting for the ConfigurationService to call the refresh() method on the ConfigurationSource.

This is the prefered method to 'update' configuration in a live environment. It will not cause any unexpected NotFoundExceptions to be thrown. This method will make all additions/updates and removes. However, it has the same constraint as the removeConfigurationSource(), which is that any previously 'overridden' value will not be restored in cases where the override variable is removed. To resolve this case, simply call the refresh method after this call.

Parameters:
source - the ConfigurationSource that has updated configuration data.

refresh

public void refresh()
             throws ConfigurationException
Convience method to call updateConfigurationSource() on each source defined in the system. In order to insure that all collisions are resolved, including the adding/removing of override variables, this method can be called twice.

fullRefresh

public void fullRefresh()
                 throws ConfigurationException
Forces the cache of configuration information to be flushed and reloaded from the ConfigurationSource instances.

This operation can be expensive, and should only be called when absolutely neccessary.

This method also may force the ConfigurationSource to be in a state without valid data. There is no mechanism to prohibit the system from accessing the source during this period of time and getting NotFoundExceptions for keys that are being 'refreshed'. Because of this, use of this method is HIGHLY DISCOURAGED. The prefered alternative is to have the sources update themselves, or an external entity update the sources one at a time using the updateConfigurationSource() method. However, if sources have been removed, or data from a source has been removed, this method must be used.

initialize

public void initialize()
This method discards the current configuration information and reinitializes the singleton with the default delimiter. ALL EXISTING CONFIGURATION WILL BE LOST. This should be used with great care as it may cause unexpected results.

After this method is called, all configuration sources will have to be re-added.

initialize

public void initialize(java.lang.String delimiter)
This method discards the current configuration information and reinitializes the singleton with the specified delimiter. ALL EXISTING CONFIGURATION WILL BE LOST. This should be used with great care as it may cause unexpected results.

After this method is called, all configuration sources will have to be re-added.

This method should only be called from a 'startup class'.

Parameters:
delimiter - the delimiter to use to seperate the node names in the keys.

getDelimiter

public java.lang.String getDelimiter()
Returns the delimiter currently being used to seperate the nodes in a key.
Returns:
current delimiter

getValue

public java.lang.String getValue(java.lang.String key)
                          throws NotFoundException
Returns the value of the specified key. The key may reference either a value defined at the root node, or the delimited location of the value in the configuration tree.
Parameters:
key - The key to a specific parameter.
Returns:
parameter referenced by the specified key.
Throws:
NotFoundException - thrown when the specified key does not map to a parameter.

getValues

public java.util.Properties getValues()
Returns a java.util.Properties object containing all the values defined at the root node.
Returns:
Properties object containing all parameters defined at the root node.

getValues

public java.util.Properties getValues(java.lang.String key)
                               throws NotFoundException
Returns a java.util.Properties object containing all the values defined at the node specified by the key.
Parameters:
key - The key to a specific node.
Returns:
properties object containing all the parameters referenced by the specified key.
Throws:
NotFoundException - thrown when the specified key does not map to a node.

getAllValues

public java.util.Properties getAllValues()
Returns a java.util.Properties object containing all the values defined at the root node, and all the values defined in children nodes. The keys for the values in the child nodes are delimited using the value returned by the 'getDelimiter()' method.
Returns:
Properties object containing all parameters defined at the root node.

getAllValues

public java.util.Properties getAllValues(java.lang.String key)
                                  throws NotFoundException
Returns a java.util.Properties object containing all the values defined at the node specified by the key, and all the values defined in children nodes. The keys for the values in the child nodes are delimited using the value returned by the 'getDelimiter()' method.
Parameters:
key - The key to a specific node.
Returns:
properties object containing all the parameters referenced by the specified key.
Throws:
NotFoundException - thrown when the specified key does not map to a node.
